result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Marie Charlotte Sisson

defendant.name: Sisson, Nicole Marie Charlotte

records.addlTxt:
9:37 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Melstrom, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Nicole Marie Charlotte Sisson in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Nicole Marie Charlotte Sisson. INCLUDES 22CF526, 22CM475 and 22TR2029.Atty. Dolfi states that an offer has been received, requests additional time to consider. Court sets PSC. Adjourned: 9:39 AM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for Modifying Conditions of Bond. Signed by RMW 8/29/22. Defendant to appear immediately at the Clerk's Office to sign amended bond.  gll

Includes 22CF526 and 22CM475.

$250 bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.L.N.A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
for modifying conditions of bond. Filed by Atty Dolfi. arc
to modify bond. Filed by Atty Dolfi. arc   to RMW

2:22 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court w/Nicole Marie Charlotte Weymouth Sisson. S/T Officer Alex VanSomeren, HPD; direct by Atty Ballo. Cross by Atty Dolfi. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Ballo will not be filing additional charges, Information will match Complaint. Atty Dolfi would like to proceed with the ARGN as would DE. Court notes if there are any discrepancies in the Information, Atty Dolfi will address the Court. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. DE updates address on record, court confirms phone number.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:49 PM CO: TCH for RMW, RPR: Melstrom, Clerk: Lindabaur ADA:  Michael Becker with Intern Connor Smith  DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi for today Defendant Nicole Marie Charlotte Sisson appeared by video, in custody.
